articles.title: Death toll from laced cocaine in Argentina climbs to 23
articles.description: The death toll among dozens of people who consumed cocaine likely laced with opioids in Buenos Aires rose to 23 on Friday, with 37 still in hospital, health officials said.
articles.content:

articles.title: 22 people killed and dozens hospitalised in Argentina after taking 'laced' cocaine
articles.description: 20,000 doses of the adulterated substance were confiscated from the area of Buenos Aires where it had been sold.
articles.content:
POLICE IN ARGENTINA seized vast quantities of cocaine yesterday likely laced with opioids and made several arrests after 22 people died and dozens ended up in hospital poisoned in Buenos Aires.

articles.title: At least 22 dead in Argentina due to laced cocaine
articles.description: Argentine police have seized vast quantities of cocaine likely laced with opioids and made several arrests after 22 people died and dozens ended up in hospital poisoned in Buenos Aires.

articles.title: IMF chief says still 'hard work' ahead on Argentina agreement
articles.description: Argentine President Alberto Fernandez and his government have been negotiating with the IMF to revamp debt outstanding from a failed $57 billion loan deal from 2018, the fund's largest ever. Argentina's dollar bond prices fell slightly on Thursday, hanging on to most gains since the understanding was announced, but not far from record lows and in deeply distressed territory.
articles.content: The head of the International Monetary Fund on Thursday said an agreement reached in principle with Argentina on a new standby loan was "pragmatic" but "hard work" still lay ahead. Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva told reporters that details of... [2919 chars]

articles.title: 'We want justice': Argentines vent anger after adulterated cocaine kills 22
articles.description: At least 22 people have died in Argentina and over 80 others have been hospitalized, many on ventilators, after consuming cocaine suspected of being adulterated, local government officials said on Thursday.
articles.content: At least 22 people have died in Argentina and over 80 others have been hospitalized, many on ventilators, after consuming cocaine suspected of being adulterated, local government officials said on Thursday. The cases https://www.reuters.com/article/a... [2848 chars]

articles.title: ‘Entre Nosotros’ Adds 11th Week Atop Billboard Argentina Hot 100 Chart
articles.description: Tiago PZK, LIT Killah, Nicki Nicole and Maria Becerra hold strong atop the Argentina Hot 100 chart as “Entre Nosotros” comes in at No. 1.
articles.content: Tiago PZK, LIT Killah, Nicki Nicole and Maria Becerra hold strong atop the Billboard Argentina Hot 100 chart (dated Jan. 29) as “Entre Nosotros” (remix) comes in at No. 1 for its 11th week. It becomes the title with fifth-most weeks at the summit, tr... [1744 chars]

articles.title: Tennis-Thiem aims to make return at Indian Wells in March
articles.description: He also pulled out of the Australian Open in January. The former world number three had planned on a return in Cordoba in Argentina this week, but was forced to withdraw from the tournament after feeling pain in the knuckles on his right hand.
articles.content: Former U.S. Open champion Dominic Thiem said on Thursday he hopes to return to action at Indian Wells in March, after being sidelined since June last year due to a wrist injury. Thiem has not played since suffering the injury at the Mallorca Open and... [1200 chars]

articles.title: Argentina reels as toxic batch of cocaine kills at least 20
articles.description: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina (AP) — A batch of cocaine that has killed at least 20 people in Argentina appears to have been laced with a synthetic opioid, and police are scrambling to get as much of it off the streets as they can.
articles.content: Sergio Berni, a security minister, arrives for a press conference at the hospital where people are being treated after consuming adulterated cocaine, in Buenos Aires, Argentina, Thursday, Feb. 3, 2022. According to local authorities, 20 people have d... [4269 chars]
